topRisks.priority_action_required: Priority action required based on risk level

drought.water_resources: Reduced water availability for drinking and irrigation, decreased reservoir levels, groundwater depletion, and potential water quality issues.
drought.food_security: Reduced crop yields, livestock stress, higher food prices, and food shortages in vulnerable communities.
drought.energy_security: Reduced hydropower generation capacity, water shortages for power plant cooling, and increased energy demand for water pumping.
drought.healthcare: Increased water-related illnesses, mental health impacts from water insecurity, and strain on healthcare facilities.
drought.general: Water shortages affecting multiple sectors, ecosystem degradation, economic impacts, and potential conflict over limited resources.

flood.water_resources: Contamination of water supplies, damage to water infrastructure, and overwhelming of water treatment systems.
flood.food_security: Crop destruction, soil erosion, livestock losses, and disruption to food distribution networks.
flood.infrastructure: Damage to buildings, roads, bridges, and utilities, with potential long-term economic impacts.
flood.healthcare: Injury and disease from water contamination, displacement, and disruption to healthcare services.
flood.general: Widespread property damage, disruption to essential services, business closures, and potential long-term economic impacts.

heat.water_resources: Increased evaporation from water bodies, higher water demand, and potential water quality issues.
heat.healthcare: Heat-related illnesses and deaths, particularly among vulnerable populations, and increased strain on healthcare facilities.
heat.energy_security: Higher energy demand for cooling, reduced transmission efficiency, and potential grid failures during peak demand.
heat.food_security: Reduced crop yields, livestock stress, irrigation challenges, and disruption to food distribution systems.
heat.general: Health impacts, energy demand spikes, infrastructure stress, and impacts on vulnerable populations.

general.water_resources: Changes to water quality and availability affecting drinking water, irrigation, and ecosystem health.
general.food_security: Disruption to food production, distribution, and access, with potential price increases.
general.healthcare: Increased demand for healthcare services, possible spread of diseases, and challenges in service delivery.
general.infrastructure: Damage to critical infrastructure, disruption to services, and increased maintenance costs.
general.energy_security: Disruption to energy production, transmission, and distribution, with potential supply shortages.
general.default: Potential impacts across multiple sectors including infrastructure, health, economy, and natural systems.
